Title: Almost 2 years of hard service!
Pros: I've used 2 of these 30Ds for sports photography, and one I have well over 100,000 pictures on. When these came out the 5 frames a second is what caught my eye. I've shot low light dance performances with a 70-200 IS lens at 800-1000 ISO and sold a lot of pictures "they where crisp and clear" now that I'm talking about it I took 13,000 pictures in 2.5 days. Now I figured the low light..... Dancing I would have to trash half ....I kept over 10,000 pictures (and sold them too). I have shot NFL,The Masters Tour,Nascar with my 30D's. Now I have the 1D Mark III and keep a 30D as my side camera and the other 30D is in the bag as a backup
Comments: If monies an issue then Save the extra money and fine a 30D instead of the 40D and Buy a Nice Canon Lens in the focal length you need. I personal think the Quality of the lens is what makes the camera.

Title: 30D
Pros: I have used the 30D for over a year now and have gotten some great pics from it. L glass is of course the best choice. Camera has worked flawlessly. I just bought a 40D and would suggest that if you can justifie the added cost that you buy it instead. Better all the way around.
Comments: Buy the 40D if you want a better all around camera. I like it better than the 5D.

Title: GREEEEAT camera
Pros: Love the camera, everyone else said what needs said

Title: You can shoot like a pro!
Cons: Price? I don't know of any real cons. Maybe the fact you end up spending lots of money on lenses and stuff, if you're like me :)
Pros: Excellent build quality. Very sturdy. Compact, fast, accurate, stylish! A definate keeper!
Comments: Newegg is great as always! This camera is similar to the 20D from Canon. I had to have the spot metering though! I bought the 20-70mm Sigma lense and 70-300mm Sigma lense. I highly sugest you invest in a quality lense for this product because the stock lense it comes with wont make your shots look like a pro! Other than that, superior product!

Title: Absolutely Amazing
Cons: In a school newspaper environment, lenses get exchanged very frequently for different sports/etc. which means that there's wear and tear on the lens mount ring.  Sometimes a bit of grease or metal grindings will settle into the mount and make for a nasty hand washing if you happen to touch it.
Pros: I have used this camera on a school newspaper for a school year, with many different lenses, and all I can say is wow.  It's image quality and responsiveness is unparalleled at this price point, and overall it's a stunning package.  The 30D has a huge screen, larger than almost any other DSLR out there, it has very easy to navigate menus.  The camera has some heft, but to its credit – it feels solid and comfortable in the hand, and makes a very pleasing shutter sound, as if it had no intention of ever falling apart.
Comments: The supplied lens with this product is just short of pathetic.  Go for the 17-85mm Canon lens with image stabilization.  It will make a lot of difference in the quality of the camera's images.  Canon is definitely superior in the "pro-sumer" DSLR market.

Title: The best
Cons: It can get a little awkward to move both the large dial with your thumb and the small dial with your finger at the same time, but as far as I know no other camera even lets you do this so it really isn't a con.
Pros:
Dual-dial system is best I've used- allows you to change two different values simultaneously, among aperture/lens speed/exposure, vafious info chart displays and histogram options are great when viewing, and of course the wide variety of Canon accessories.

5 FRAMES PER SECOND.  LIKE NO OTHER.
Comments: Bout it and a Tamron 18-200mm lens, just beautiful.

Pros: Besides the obvious technical advantages over other cameras, this camera feels great in your hands. The shutter sounds and feels great when you press that little button and the picture comes to life in the LCD.
Comments:
I had a Rebel XTi for a while and when I decided to move up I was looking at 1d, 5D and 30D. The deciding factor was the size and built-in flash for me. I'm not a professional photographer, but I wanted great photos of my family and events that we attended. 1D was too much of a camera and 5D didn't have a flash which I might've needed without having too much of a builky thing around my neck wherever I went. 30D was perfect in that sense since I can be subtle but still take great pictures. My next step would definitely be 5D since most of the accessories for 30D fits 5D. (except for the battery grip) However I doubt that I'll need more camera than 30D...

Also, please spend a little more money and invest in top quality lenses. To put a cheap lense on this camera is a crime.

Title: Great camera
Pros: Great camera. Layout is funtional and easy to learn. Takes great pics. Instruction book easy to use.

Title: Good camera
Cons: I bought it six month ago so the price was 150$ higher than now.
Pros:
This camera is the champ. I"ve been using it for more than 6 months and decided to write a review. It works fast, very good for sports photographer. I upgraded from Fuji S7000, so it's a big different.IF you buy the right lens, the image turns out sharp and focused. If you buy cheap -low quality lens.. the results will disappointed.

The color and settings may take you a month to get used to. I used to look at my Fuji Colortone photos so when I switch to this, it's sometimes make me think that the Canon doesn't produce the right color.
IT takes time and do some settings to get everything work as you'd like it to be.
Comments: Some other good all around lens(Price and performance):  Canon F1.8 50mm, F1.4 50mm USM, Tamron 17-50mm F2.8 .Sigma 18-50 F2.8

Pros: I'll keep this short..  Great digital camera by Canon.  Not a bad price and works as expected.
Comments:
Newegg did an awesome job as usual!!  Camera arrived fast - when it was supposed to get here, and well packaged - no damage.  

There are many places to buy digital/products of this type online now days.  Newegg just makes it a "no-worries" experience.

Thanks Newegg!
